review: Highly disappointed. But I suppose it's my fault for not researching this product more thoroughly. This device does not deliver 1080p. I had my laptop connected to my TV for the longest time because it allowed me to watch 1080p on a big screen. I thought the Fire Stick would be a good idea because I'd be using my laptop less for such applications--I also figured there would be less clutter on my desk with the Stick. The device is compact, easy to take with you anywhere, and has some other nice attributes. Still, I am disappointed with its output. Plus, one would think that if it plugs into the TV's HDMI input, it should be HD! Not only that, but I am constantly seeing the TV stick being used in advertisements without a power cord--you have to plug in this thing for it to work. I assumed the HDMI input would charge the TV Stick. Well, you know what they say happens when you "ASSUME." I am not saying this item is completely terrible, because some will undoubtedly find it useful.
author: mark "Mark Valdez"

review: I ordered this because my in-laws purchased one and they highly recommended it. However, when I received mine, I have been having trouble all day trying to connect to my WiFi. I have multiple devices and consoles that require WiFi connection and everything connects but this Fire TV Stick. I have even restored the stick to factory settings, tried different HDMI slots and another TV just to make sure it wasn't just mine. I kept receiving error messages such as "check your password" "the signal is too low" "contact amazon or your internet provider" "signal is not in range". I know it is not my WiFi because, like I stated before, every other device I have connects with ease (xbox one, ps4, laptops, iPad, iPhones, Windows Surface, smart TVs, etc.) I returned my item and do not plan on purchasing another one.
author: Miss_Dre
